Detailed Description

Traceroute Doer. Handles the workflow for single or batch traceroute requests from the GUI. Typically, the application instantiates one of these for the duration of the program.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TrDo::TrDo ( PStatus *  pstat,
QWidget *  owner 
)

constructor

Parameters:
pstat points to a program status
owner points to the high-level owning widget
Initialize the GUI-independent layer. Select between available low-level traceroute doer programs, determine the number of traceroute probes per hop, and the default privacy settings.

Member Function Documentation

void TrDo::tracerouteHost ( const QString &  host  ) 

do a traceroute to a single host

Parameters:
host is a hostname or IPv4 dotted-quad address
Run a single traceroute. A new traceroute status object is created, and a call to runTraceroute() is wrapped. The GUI status bar is updated. Upon completion, the tracerouteFinished() signal is emitted.

void TrDo::tracerouteBatch ( const QString &  batch,
QProgressDialog *  pdlg 
)

do a batch of traceroutes

Parameters:
batch is the name of the batch as presented via GUI
pdlg points to a progress dialog widget
Run a traceroute batch. The batch filename is mapped to the true filename on the server, then the batch file is fetched and parsed.

Lines starting with "host " denote hostnames to run traceroutes to. All other lines are treated as comments.

See also:
tracerouteHost()

bool TrDo::trsetsReady (  ) 

traceroute batch sets are available for use

Get traceroute batch file names from the server if they already have not been fetched. The filenames are "unmangled" to be easy for the user to view via the GUI.

See also:
trsUnmangle()

void TrDo::trsUnmangle ( QString &  unmangled,
QString &  mangled 
) [private]

unmangle a traceroute-set filename from the server

Parameters:
unmangled is the unmangled version to be shown via GUI
mangled is the filename on the server
Todo:
{ make mangled const }
Unmangle a .trset filename from the server. As the web server directory listing is in sorted order, the filenames are preceeded by decimal digits and then a colon character. This scheme allows the ordering as presented to the user to be determined by the actual filename used in deployment. The user is then shown a list of virtual filenames in priority order.

bool TrDo::newTrStatus ( const QString &  h_name,
bool  in_batch,
int  op_num 
) [private]

create a new traceroute status object and add it to the history

Parameters:
h_name is the hostname
in_batch is true iff the traceroute is part of a batch
op_num is sequential operation number for the process
Create a new traceroute status object, adding it to the history.

void TrDo::childFinished ( int  exitCode,
QProcess::ExitStatus  exitStatus 
) [private, slot]

slot called when the child process finishes

Parameters:
exitCode is the child process exit code
exitStatus is a Qt QProcess::ExitStatus enum
Slot called when the child process is done. If the child exited without any error, the standard output from the child is parsed, the privacy setting applied to the traceroute which is then formatted for submission to the server as an HTTP POST, then then submitted. If there was an error code from the child, it is mapped into the TrStatus::errCode enum range.

void TrDo::childError ( QProcess::ProcessError  error  )  [private, slot]

slot called if the child process could not be created

Parameters:
error is the reason from Qt

Todo:

void TrDo::runTraceroute ( const QString &  host  )  [private]

run a traceroute

Parameters:
host is the hostname or a dotted-quad
Run a traceroute. Only one traceroute can be run at a time. A temporary TrWorkItem work item is created for the prospective traceroute. If the hostname is resolvable to an IP address, the low-level traceroute doer program is started in a separate process. The process completion is waited for in a loop that wakes up every 100 milliseconds to allow the GUI to remain responsive.

void TrDo::msgChildError ( QProcess::ProcessError  err  )  [private]

Handle child process failures.

Parameters:
err is a Qt QProcess::ProcessError enum
Handle child process failures. These do not include the child exiting with a non-zero exit code. The Qt QProcess::ProcessError enum values are mapped into the TrStatus::errCode enum range. If the error is not because the user issued a cancel request via the GUI, pop-up a critical MessageBox and emit a criticalError() signal.
